6. Repeal of the Municipal Regulation for the Sustainable Growth of Local Accommodation in Porto.
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola said that this proposal, in her perspective, does not make sense, because something that happens is immediately a reason to revoke the Local Accommodation Regulation and never to suspend it. He added that this demonstrates how this Executive does not intend to regulate this activity.
He said that if there is already suspension in the most pressured areas of the City, and even broader than what is proposed in the amendment to the Law, including vertical property, villas and others, what the City Council has to do in this process and to respond to housing needs and the balance of AL - Local Accommodation is the Municipal Housing Charter that,  since 2019, it has been the competence of the Chamber. He said that he knows that the Charter is in execution and took the opportunity to ask what state it is in.
He said that there are new powers for the Chamber, which will be able to cancel ghost or inactive registrations and there is now a period of 5 years for each license. He added that these are proposals that were made by the Porto City Council itself and the method of application of these measures depends on the Municipal Regulation, which should provide for how this matter is applied and the period that the Municipality has to do so. He asked if they are going to give up this possibility now that they are going to repeal the Regulation, because the Regulation is necessary to do these matters.
In this sense, he considered that, although they voted against this Regulation, it should be revised and not repealed.
You said that the BE is against the repeal of the Regulation against which you voted; considered that this is the typical policy of the BE.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo said that in this proposal there are points, in the Recitals, that are justified, that result from a "More Housing" legislation that the PCP voted against and, therefore, she feels free to criticize this legislation. He said that this law does not solve any problem and, in practice, transfers to the municipalities responsibilities that they know that they then have no conditions, nor money, nor means to comply with them.
He mentioned that between Point 6 and Point 13 of the Recitals, there are aspects that seem to him to be well presented, but this cannot leave aside the fact that the legislation is not regulated nor does it prevent the existence of a Regulation in the Municipality regarding AL.
He considered it extemporaneous to present this proposal without regulations that allow safeguarding the containment zones and mitigating this problem.
He noted that it is true that the Government has defined situations that, from his point of view, are incorrect, but it is also true that it has not regulated anything and that this is not in force.
He said that, with this, they no longer have any control in AL and this will be very bad for the City of Porto, which is already being very affected by this problem of lack of housing.
He declared that he will vote against. He considered that this proposal should be withdrawn at this stage and wait to see what the Government will do in terms of regulating this legislation, then they would talk about it again.
You said that you hope that the European Commission will not approve this legislation that the government has decided to make. He considered, however, that Councillor Ilda Figueiredo is also in the same position, that is, she did not like the Regulation and now she does not want it to be revoked. You said that you can create other conditions, but this regulation, as it stands, has become obsolete.
Councillor Ricardo Valente said that these first two interventions show the enormous confusion that exists regarding the role of the Chamber as a regulatory body and the role of the Chamber as a supervisory body, which are two completely different situations.
He said that this process demonstrates the difference between someone who believes in the principle of subsidiarity of a territory, who believes that, in a municipality, a regulation, which was approved by a large majority in the Executive and in the Municipal Assembly, is completely destroyed by a centralist logic that, in practice, places in the hands of the Municipality the task of supervising a Law that is decided in Lisbon.
He stressed that this Law is so bad that it mixes everything. He explained that this Law suspends local accommodation throughout the country on the coast, allowing it to take place in the interior, but only suspends it for property that is in the form of an apartment and in the form of a building in horizontal property. He added that, as of October 7, in the City of Porto, anyone who has a single-family house in the Historic Center, which is currently a containment zone, can explore AL. He considered that it is important to have the notion that anyone who has a building in full ownership can also do so. He said that the Government destroyed the Regulation of any municipality. He stressed that this is not a tantrum, it is a matter of principle, because this Regulation, as of today, is nothing because there are no containment zones, because what exists is a suspension of apartments in the City of Porto and buildings in horizontal property and there is the complete liberalization of everything that is houses and buildings in full ownership.
He said that if they go to the electronic one-stop shop of AL it is possible to register any AL in any Portuguese territory. He added that the Law was approved on October 7 and a month later nothing has been done.
He said that there is currently a platform of the AMA - Agency for Administrative Modernization that does not respond to anything, that is, there is no indication of what the new Law is.
He mentioned, as an example, that the Law states that, in any territory in Portugal, any house in permanent housing can operate as AL without restriction, as long as the AL does not occur on more than 120 days a year. He added that Portugal is the only country in Europe where AL is an economic activity registered with the AT - Tax Authority; Portugal is the only country in Europe where there is a central LA registration system. He stressed that all European systems have failed. He said that it is impossible to supervise the 120-day deadline
He reinforced that this is not a tantrum, it is about respect for something that was in the electoral manifesto of those who won the elections in the City of Porto; respect for this Executive that approved the Regulation; respect for the Porto Municipal Assembly that approved this Regulation and which was totally destroyed by a Law, which does not define what supervisory powers the parish councils will have.
You said that this Law is the mirror of the logic, of the tasking that you have been talking about, because it is a Law that removes from the municipalities all regulatory powers and carries on top of the municipalities all the innocuous tasks of implementing a policy that was defined by the Central Government.
He said that in the containment zones there were more than 280 AL requests and the City of Porto granted 40 licenses.
He noted that the Councillor of the CDU and the Councillor of the BE have a Law that allows that in the Historic Centre and in the containment areas of the City of Porto there are AL 120 days a year freely, in any type of AL; there is AL 365 days a year in houses in the Historic Center; there is AL 365 days a year in buildings in full ownership. He stressed that this is an unregulated deregulation, because it did not take into account what the local realities are and for that reason they are asking for the repeal of this Regulation.
The President said that the only reason for having a Municipal Regulation was to be able to manage the containment areas, but the Government extinguished the containment areas. He said that they cannot maintain a Regulation that does not work. He added that if the Law is changed, they will make another regulation.
He considered that the "More Housing" Program is, in principle, a disaster. He added that there are people who are irreplaceable and others who are replaceable in the Government, such as in the Chambers and in everything. In his opinion, this is a process based on intentions and dreams, in which the municipalities were not heard.
He said that they will not maintain a Municipal Regulation, against which the Councilors voted, which is innocuous and has become ridiculous in light of the Law that is approved.
From his point of view, if Pedro Nuno Santos were still a Minister in this area, this would never have happened, because they listened to the municipalities and listened to their experience.
He said that objectively the Government has deregulated the activity and wants to pass on the role of inspection to the Chamber, and the Government could do so through the AT.
He reinforced that they cannot maintain a Regulation that does not regulate anything.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo said that, in relation to the criticism of the existing legislation, she has a convergence with what was said.
He asked why there is talk of 10 500 contributory declarations.
Councilor Ricardo Valente said that this is the number of AL that exist in the City of Porto and the Law places the need for municipalities to analyze the contributory declarations.
The President asked if Councillor Ilda Figueiredo does not consider that it should be the AT.
Councilwoman Ilda Figueiredo reinforced that she shares these criticisms.
He said that they have always defended that there should be a regulation of AL and defend it in a broader way than the one that was approved, but, at this moment, taking into account this legislation that is not yet regulated, he proposed that the Regulation be maintained, which, despite being mitigated, is not yet annulled, because the Law is not yet regulated.
He declared that he is voting against because, at this stage, it is better to maintain this Regulation than to have none.
You said that it is not regulated only because it needs an opinion. He added that everything is regulated except inspection. He said that it may be that the Government understands, with this political measure, that it would be better to look at regulation again and return to decentralization to regulation, because, seen from Lisbon, it may be that Porto is the same as Espinho and Viana do Castelo, but seen from Porto it is different. He underlined that there were competences that the Government had assigned to the municipalities and rightly so.
He reinforced that, in 2018, they praised the Government for having put an end to what was a mess, as no one regulated anything. He said that the Government understood that regulation should be done by the municipalities, but now understands the opposite.
Councillor Mariana Macedo said that they understand the revocation and from the moment there is a Regulation that is no longer useful, it is the same as not having it, which could bring more confusion than clarification.
He explained that if the Law comes into force it applies, therefore, it is not possible, at this time, to have new ALs and if it is not possible there is no question of containment, because the containment is national with the exception of some areas of the country.
He considered that they agree with the BE with regard to the incompetence of the Government and the legislation, because, although the Law establishes a certain situation, the platforms allow submission; then they will see the legal consequence of this, with tacit approvals and possible compensation.
He stressed that they agree that the Law is erratic and poorly done. He stated that the Government, in addition to the legal issue, did not adapt the instruments at its disposal to implement it, but they do not agree that it is not perceptible that, given the circumstances, this Regulation is no longer of any use, because its principle has been annulled under the national law.
On the issue of the 120 days, he said that what will happen is an incentive to the parallel economy, because when you try to regulate everything and when you try to have this control of the system, this situation is being enhanced.
He considered it positive that, regardless of whether the Regulation is changed, that the Ombudsman continues to have a proactive role and clarification of the people who continue to have their business. He added that the genesis of AL is being distorted, because when it emerged in the City of Porto it was related to small landowners who made rehabilitations and provided many jobs, and this is what is being put at risk. He stressed that they are killing an important economy for the City of Porto.
He stated that he does not understand the logic of always seeing the appearance of AL in a negative and persecutory way. He added that this is related to the issue of centralist political arrogance and not trusting the competence of municipalities.
Councillor Pedro Baganha said that a Law that has not yet been regulated, but which is already in force and which is taking work is the Law on the Municipal Housing Charter. He added that after the Basic Law on Housing was approved, there were nine months to be regulated, but this never happened and it is not for that reason that it loses effectiveness. He said that the lack of regulation in this particular Law does not prejudice the entry into force of the said Law and its effects.
He noted that the Municipal Housing Charter, despite not being regulated, is in progress. He added that, initially, they expected to be able to finish it by the end of this year, but this regulatory instability did not help, because they realized, halfway through, that this Municipal Housing Charter has much broader consequences beyond the strict matter of housing, namely this AL; therefore, they are waiting for a legal opinion that will clarify doubts they have about the degree of action possible after a Municipal Housing Charter is approved. He said that, while there is no legal opinion, the works are suspended, for that reason it will possibly be in the first quarter of next year that they will bring the Municipal Housing Charter for approval.
He expressed his concern about the existence of an excess of AL in some territories of the Municipality, but possibly it also makes sense that there is AL in other territories of the Municipality because there is not a density similar to that of the Historic Center. He explained that they do not know if it is possible to do this in the Municipal Housing Charter without harming or conditioning the entire municipality with regard to access to funds for housing; This is the doubt that needs an explanation.
Councillor Tiago Barbosa Ribeiro said that the PS will not follow this proposal. He explained that the PS has always defended areas of containment for AL in the City of Porto, balanced with the economic activity of AL and with the right to housing in the areas where AL has more prevalence, in the case of the Historic Center.
He said that they approved, on the recommendation of the PS, in 2022, the creation of containment areas for AL; then they had the Regulation, expressing agreement and disagreement on detailed issues that led to an abstention. It considered, based on the data made available, that the Regulation fulfilled precisely what was the regulatory objective, that is, reducing the number of new requests for AL in the containment areas. From his point of view, it is a good Regulation that is always susceptible to being revisited, improved and adapted. He said that they agree with the Regulation and do not want to see it repealed, so they will vote.
He said that one of the principles of the "More Housing" Program aroused criticism of statism by AL operators. He said that the "More Housing" Program did not revoke Article 15-A of the containment areas. He stressed that the possibility for municipalities to define containment areas, on top of the "More Housing" Program, remains and there is no problem, because this article has not been revoked. He added that he knows that this is the opinion of those who led the "More Housing" Program and it continues to be his position, so they maintain that position and will not follow this proposal.
Councillor Ricardo Valente said that he did not revoke the Article, but changed it substantively, because from the moment that it is the General Law that says that all licenses for apartments and buildings in horizontal property are suspended throughout the national territory, with the exception of the interior; and that licenses are not suspended for houses and buildings in full ownership, means that containment is made, from the outset, based on ownership. He said that this was not the principle that the PS voted on in the Porto City Council. He clarified that they voted on a principle of connection between AL and housing. He underlined that Porto is the only city in the country that has a Regulation where there is the numerus clausus and where, in any parish of the City of Porto, once the limit is reached, there is a containment zone that does not discriminate property. He said that the Article is still unchanged, because the General Law already contains AL in a logic of ownership. He stated that, in Porto, they cannot accept, anywhere in the City, an apartment or a building where there are autonomous fractions, but they can accept, in any area of the City, houses. He noted that Porto has, in Campanhã, 4516 houses; asked if everyone agrees that all these houses can be AL.
You said that the only plausible reason for the Government to want to regulate and interfere in AL is its legitimate concern with the problem of competition with housing.
He said that in residential buildings, from the moment that what is a tourist use grows, the percentage of accommodation for citizens decreases. He asked if they consider that controlling Al for 120 days solves the situation.
He said that the only reason why some European cities created a maximum limit on the length of stay in LA was to discourage the appetite for AL and to control, at certain times of the year, the tourist flow, because they wanted this accommodation, in the periods when it was not rented to LA, to be for student residence. He stressed that the Minister created a four-month rule without having any objective.
He stressed that he understands the intention of this Law, that is, to limit AL, but, at the moment, it is not worth having a Regulation in relation to which they cannot regulate anything and if the State wants to regulate, let it decide everything.
He said that Councillor Tiago Barbosa Ribeiro is right when he says that there were criticisms about being too statist and others about being too liberal, which only shows incoherence, because these solutions should not be resolved by ideological issues. He stressed that, for the same reason, he never said that, in the event that the State can intervene in private property, that it should affect it, because that is not an ideological issue.
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola said that this Regulation does not regulate as much as the BE understands it should. He confirmed that the BE is in favor of regulation, it is not in favor of this regulation, but it is not in favor of any, which is what is on the table, that is, that there is no regulation. He added that the containment remains in the Law and can be modeled to house the houses of Campanhã. He said that if they are concerned that these houses will be AL, they should adapt the Regulation so that this does not happen.
He considered that there is a rush, as the Regulation should be revised, but it should not be repealed.
Councillor Ricardo Valente said that Councillor Maria Manuel Rola fell into her own trap. He recalled that Councillor Maria Manuel Rola was against the Regulation, because there were a "lot of trapdoors" and that the Chamber's Regulation was not going to regulate anything, however, today the Councillor already says that the Regulation regulated.
The President said that since the BE proposes a regulatory model, he suggested that it propose a new Regulation.
Councillor Tiago Barbosa Ribeiro considered that everyone is telling the truth, that is, no one is contradicting each other.
He said that the "More Housing" Program, in the points referring to AL, introduces the rules that were mentioned; these rules are introduced by a political, economic and housing access context that is known to all and this is done with the aim of seeking to drain properties that are currently allocated to AL, especially in city centres, for other types of uses, namely for long-term rental. He said that this is not contradictory with the prevalence of the possibility that the instrument of municipalities can regulate containment zones on top of this dimension of AL in the "More Housing" Program; Article 15-A, with the seven paragraphs corresponding to the containment zones, remains in force.
He said that the assumption of the initial debate was that the municipalities could not make containment zones, but they can because there is nothing in the "More Housing" Program that prevents the municipalities from introducing the impossibility of having AL in the houses of the Historic Center.
Councillor Ricardo Valente said that it is not true, because the "More Housing" Programme poses the situation that if a Portuguese municipality grants an AL license, that municipality is not entitled to any funds from the PRR - Recovery and Resilience Plan from the point of view of housing financing.
He said that they are repealing a Regulation, because everything is going to change. He considered that, for the good of the City, the political parties will have to position themselves on what they want to regulate from the point of view of AL based on conditions that are completely new.
The President mentioned that the Prime Minister said that if the cities want to have AL there is no housing support, so leave that competence to the Government.
He stated that if they do not regulate anything, they cannot be penalized for licensing.
Councillor Alberto Machado underlined that the PSD has always been in favour of the existence of a regulation.
You have stated that you will vote in favour of this proposal precisely because of what has just been said, because you had some circumstances that led to the adoption of the Regulation that is still in force and now you have other circumstances that are not compatible with the Regulation.
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola said that, according to Councillor Ricardo Valente, they cannot grant any AL license in the City of Porto otherwise they lose funds from the PRR and, at the same time, said that it is possible to register housing and vertical property. He asked whether or not it is possible to assign AL licenses in the City.
Councilman Ricardo Valente said that it is possible. The Law read: "The municipalities expressly define in the respective municipal housing charters, approved under the terms of Article 22 of Law 83/2019, of September 3, the appropriate balance of the supply of housing and student accommodation in their respective territory, which allows the end of the suspension provided for in the previous Article." He added that in the previous article only the apartments are suspended.
Approved, by majority, with 4 votes against from the Councillors of the PS and the Councillors of the CDU and BE.
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola said that she will deliver an explanation of vote. (Annex V)

10. Aprovação da celebração de um contrato de constituição de direito de superfície, tendo por objeto mediato o bem imóvel denominado «Parque Central da Asprela».
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo considerou que, pelo que percebeu desta proposta, que o direito de superfície funciona ao contrário do que é habitual; normalmente é votado um direito de superfície porque o Município cede a outros a utilização de um espaço, equipamento ou território. Referiu que, neste caso, acontece o contrário, ou seja, a Câmara assume a responsabilidade da gestão deste território que é da Universidade, passando a sua gestão para o Município.
Acrescentou que, a partir de agora, todas as questões relacionadas com equipamentos, bom funcionamento e manutenção deste espaço, é da responsabilidade da Câmara Municipal.
O Senhor Presidente disse que não está na especialidade das universidades e dos politécnicos a manutenção e gestão de jardins. Acrescentou que, até agora, a Câmara não o podia fazer exatamente pelo mesmo princípio que tem no Centro Comercial STOP, ou seja, realizar intervenções de determinado cariz em espaços que não eram da Câmara.
Afirmou que se trata de regular a atividade que vai permitir que o Senhor Vice-Presidente possa tratar daquele parque como se fosse da Câmara.
O Senhor Vice-Presidente Filipe Araújo disse que normalmente aquela zona é frequentada por pessoas mais relacionadas com a Academia, com as universidades e com o Politécnico que lá existe. Deu nota de que se trata de um grande espaço da Cidade onde vivem muitas pessoas ao seu redor. Acrescentou que aquele espaço desempenha um papel na Cidade e que a Universidade esteve de acordo em passar a gestão, o que possibilita que o Município do Porto, a partir do momento em que seja escriturado, faça a gestão da área verde e aproveite o espaço para desenvolver um conjunto de atividades que são úteis para a Cidade.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo afirmou que está de acordo e que este é um espaço importante para a Cidade.
O Senhor Presidente disse que ouviam reclamações por parte dos utilizadores que o Parque não tinha o mesmo tipo de recursos que tem o Parque Oriental ou o Parque da Cidade.
A Senhora Vereadora Rosário Gambôa disse que aquele parque nasceu de uma parceria virtuosa, através de um financiamento com a Águas do Porto, com a Porto Lazer, com o Politécnico do Porto e com a Universidade do Porto, que é que detém o solo. Referiu que esse espaço se destinava a ser um equipamento voltado para a Cidade, preenchendo uma lacuna muito grande que existia na Asprela em termos de um espaço de circulação e de habitabilidade, e simultaneamente correspondia à questão da impermeabilização dos solos.
Aprovada, por unanimidade.
segments.text_en:
10. Approval of the conclusion of a contract for the constitution of surface rights, having as mediate object the immovable property called «Parque Central da Asprela».
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo considered that, from what she understood from this proposal, that the surface right works contrary to what is usual; normally a surface right is voted because the Municipality cedes the use of a space, equipment or territory to others. He said that, in this case, the opposite happens, that is, the Chamber assumes responsibility for the management of this territory that belongs to the University, passing its management to the Municipality.
He added that, from now on, all issues related to equipment, proper functioning and maintenance of this space are the responsibility of the City Council.
You said that the maintenance and management of gardens is not in the specialty of universities and polytechnics. He added that, until now, the City Council could not do it exactly for the same principle that it has in the STOP Shopping Center, that is, to carry out interventions of a certain nature in spaces that were not the City Hall's.
He said that it is a matter of regulating the activity that will allow the Vice-President to treat that park as if it were the Chamber's.
Vice-President Filipe Araújo said that normally that area is frequented by people more related to the Academy, universities and the Polytechnic that exists there. He noted that it is a large space in the city where many people live around it. He added that that space plays a role in the City and that the University agreed to pass on the management, which allows the Municipality of Porto, from the moment it is deeded, to manage the green area and take advantage of the space to develop a set of activities that are useful for the City.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo said that she agrees and that this is an important space for the City.
The President said that they heard complaints from users that the Park did not have the same type of resources as the Oriental Park or the City Park.
Councillor Rosário Gambôa said that that park was born from a virtuous partnership, through funding with Águas do Porto, Porto Lazer, the Polytechnic of Porto and the University of Porto, which owns the land. He said that this space was intended to be an equipment facing the City, filling a very large gap that existed in Asprela in terms of a circulation and habitability space, and simultaneously corresponded to the issue of soil waterproofing.
Approved, unanimously.

11. Apoio do Município do Porto à "Rede de Cidades e Vilas que Caminham".
A Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola deu nota de que é uma rede congénere do Estado Espanhol, que tem como Presidente ********************* *********************************** e Presidente da Câmara *************.
Relativamente à matéria em questão, perguntou por que razão o Porto não adere à rede em si.
Disse que, pelo que percebeu, existe um apoio à rede, mas não há uma adesão.
O Senhor Vereador Pedro Baganha disse que tentaram aceder à rede o mais depressa que conseguiram, no entanto, foi exigido um conjunto de burocracias como o registo criminal de quem está à frente da rede, o orçamento dos últimos anos e o visto do Tribunal de Contas. Considerou que a burocracia é insuportável.
Referiu que esta é uma matéria que pretendia ter trazido a reunião de Executivo no início do ano, mas só agora foi possível porque foram esbarrando num conjunto de dificuldades de ordem técnico-jurídica que levaram ao adiamento desta proposta até este momento. Acrescentou que a melhor forma de apoiarem e pertencerem a esta rede é com a proposta em questão, que configura um apoio à rede.
Aprovada, por unanimidade.
segments.text_en:
11. Support from the Municipality of Porto to the "Network of Cities and Towns that Walk".
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola noted that it is a similar network of the Spanish State, which has as President ********************* *********************************** and Mayor *************.
Regarding the matter in question, he asked why Porto does not join the network itself.
He said that, from what he understood, there is support for the network, but there is no adherence.
Councillor Pedro Baganha said that they tried to access the network as quickly as they could, however, a set of bureaucracies was required such as the criminal record of those who are in charge of the network, the budget of recent years and the visa of the Court of Auditors. He considered that the bureaucracy is unbearable.
He said that this is a matter that he intended to have brought to the Executive meeting at the beginning of the year, but only now it was possible because they were running into a set of technical-legal difficulties that led to the postponement of this proposal until this moment. He added that the best way to support and belong to this network is with the proposal in question, which configures support for the network.
Approved, unanimously.

12. Aprovação da minuta da terceira adenda ao Contrato de Mandato a celebrar com a CMPEAE -- Empresa de Águas e Energia do Município do Porto, EM.
A Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola disse que se trata de uma alteração considerável aos valores. Referiu que já discutiram isto anteriormente e falou-se sobre problemas com o licenciamento na produção para o autoconsumo e comunidades renováveis, perguntou se isso se mantém.
O Senhor Vice-Presidente Filipe Araújo respondeu que sim. Referiu que a adenda que estão a aprovar é uma reafectação de verbas e está muito relacionada com aquele projeto que já teve oportunidade de apresentar e que já foi tornada pública a intenção de o replicar pelo resto do Município.
Sublinhou que as comunidades energéticas em Portugal ainda não são uma realidade.
Deu nota pública de que têm tentado vencer as várias dificuldades burocráticas. Referiu que identificam áreas prioritárias, querem avançar com as mesmas, mas existe muita burocracia envolvida o que dificulta o processo.
Disse que a comunidade Agra do Amial, apesar de ter os painéis instalados em cima das casas das 180 famílias que lá vivem desde dezembro do ano passado, ainda não deu nenhuma energia àquelas habitações.
Afirmou que estão a vencer paulatinamente as várias dificuldades que vão aparecendo e espera que até ao final do ano tenham condições de colocar uma primeira comunidade energética a funcionar.
Deu nota de que já existe a mesma entidade a fazer uma comunidade e a colocá-la a funcionar, mas comunidades energéticas que sirvam 180 associados diferentes ainda não existe, sendo uma dificuldade que ainda não foi ultrapassada.
A Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola disse que a argumentação que está na proposta não refere estes entraves, mas deveria.
Referiu que este contrato termina no final deste ano e está-se a reduzir 500 mil euros de afetação à produção energética renovável e é necessário perceber se isto vai ser reafectado em novo contrato. Solicitou que, em futuras propostas, a argumentação sobre a razão de isto acontecer esteja presente.
Aprovada, por unanimidade.
segments.text_en:
12. Approval of the draft of the third addendum to the Mandate Contract to be signed with CMPEAE - Water and Energy Company of the Municipality of Porto, EM.
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola said that this is a considerable change to the values. He said that they have discussed this before and talked about problems with licensing in production for self-consumption and renewable communities, he asked if this continues.
Vice-President Filipe Araújo replied yes. He said that the addendum they are approving is a reallocation of funds and is very much related to that project that he has already had the opportunity to present and that the intention to replicate it by the rest of the Municipality has already been made public.
He stressed that energy communities in Portugal are not yet a reality.
He made a public note that they have been trying to overcome the various bureaucratic difficulties. He said that they identify priority areas, they want to move forward with them, but there is a lot of bureaucracy involved, which makes the process difficult.
He said that the Agra do Amial community, despite having the panels installed on top of the houses of the 180 families who have lived there since December last year, has not yet given any energy to those houses.
He said that they are gradually overcoming the various difficulties that are appearing and hopes that by the end of the year they will be able to put a first energy community into operation.
He noted that there is already the same entity making a community and putting it into operation, but energy communities that serve 180 different members do not yet exist, being a difficulty that has not yet been overcome.
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola said that the argument in the proposal does not mention these obstacles, but it should.
He said that this contract ends at the end of this year and 500 thousand euros of allocation to renewable energy production is being reduced and it is necessary to understand if this will be reallocated in a new contract. He requested that, in future proposals, the argument about why this happens be present.
Approved, unanimously.

14. Submissão a consulta pública da 2.ª Revisão do Plano Municipal de Emergência de Proteção Civil do Porto.
A Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola sublinhou a relevância deste Plano Municipal de Emergência de Proteção Civil, pois tem tido várias questões na Cidade do Porto que reportam para a Proteção Civil e para o Plano Municipal de Emergência. Acrescentou que há questões que se levantam sobre o Plano em si que gostaria de ver esclarecidas antes da consulta pública, que estão relacionadas com a ideia da resposta sazonal em saúde e a necessidade de existir um plano de contingência para as pessoas em situação de sem-abrigo que não é, de forma nenhuma, abordada neste Plano Municipal. Abordou a questão dos locais de abrigo temporários que, na resposta sazonal em saúde, indica que tem de se estar no Plano Municipal de Emergência de Proteção Civil e também não estão, estando apenas as zonas de concentração e acolhimento da população que diminuem de 13 para 4. Perguntou qual a razão para esta diminuição.
Perguntou também onde estão os planos especiais do Centro Histórico e de cheias; e onde está a carta de risco das áreas inundáveis que existia na versão anterior, que considera ser de extrema relevância que se mantenha e que exista um plano relativamente a esta questão.
Sugeriu a existência de uma subcomissão permanente no caso de cheias e inundações como a Lei permite.
Questionou sobre a rede meteorológica municipal, que lhe parece que poderá ter impacto no acionar de alguns mecanismos, nomeadamente na questão da mudança térmica que é mais sensível e consegue definir melhor na Cidade quais são os graus que estão a ocorrer. Perguntou se está em funcionamento, se estão todos os pontos, quantos pontos são e se está a ser canalizada para fazer essa identificação para resposta à população mais vulnerável.
A Senhora Vereadora Catarina Araújo solicitou a autorização ao Senhor Presidente para que o Senhor Diretor *******************************************, *************, e o Senhor Chefe ************************************************************, **************, possam dar algum esclarecimento sobre questões mais técnicas e operacionais que foram suscitadas pela Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola.
Disse que há alguma confusão, porque os planos de contingência para o tempo frio que a Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola refere não fazem parte integrante deste plano nem devem fazer. Acrescentou que se trata de questões autónomas que estão a ser tratadas de forma autónoma.
O Chefe ************************************************************, ************** disse que o Plano Municipal de Emergência de Proteção Civil trabalha os riscos naturais, tecnológicos e mistos e abordam a questão de onda de frio e onda de calor, o que é muito mais exigente que uma reação a tempo frio que estão agora a definir no âmbito de um plano de contingência. Esclareceu que não é trabalhado o plano de contingência na vertente de um Plano Municipal de Emergência de Proteção Civil.
Sobre a cartografia de risco e a questão das inundações, disse que estão a trabalhar numa revisão ao Plano Municipal de Emergência de Proteção Civil que será a segunda revisão que obedece a uma diretiva, a uma resolução da Comissão Nacional de Proteção Civil, por isso passarão a ter um Plano Municipal de Emergência de Proteção Civil de terceira e última geração. Acrescentou que a cartografia de risco foi retirada da elaboração desta nova geração de planos municipais de emergência, porque na maioria das vezes conseguem falar é da suscetibilidade de ocorrência do risco e não há um período necessário, um histórico de antecedentes necessário para chegarem efetivamente àquilo que é o risco.
A Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola perguntou por que razão os locais de abrigo temporário não estão definidos na carta e por que razão existe a redução das zonas de concentração e acolhimento de população de 13 para 4.
Disse que os planos de contingência e dos planos especiais são autónomos, mas nem sequer são nomeados no próprio Plano Municipal de Emergência de Proteção Civil e, na sua opinião, devia existir essa articulação.
O Chefe*************************************************************, ************** disse, relativamente às zonas de concentração e acolhimento de população, que definiram 3 e distribuíram esses espaços por zonas da Cidade que parecem ser suficientes para dar resposta. Acrescentou que têm o levantamento de estabelecimentos escolares e outras entidades que reúnem os requisitos para formar uma zona de concentração e acolhimento de população.
Sobre os locais de abrigo, considerou que estão conexas com a questão do plano de contingência para o tempo frio e isso está a ser trabalhado num plano de contingência que estão a elaborar.
Relativamente à questão das cheias, disse que na Cidade do Porto existe um centro de previsão e prevenção de cheias que se encontra na sede da capitania do Porto Douro, cujo capitão do Porto Douro é o responsável por convocar todas as entidades competentes que integram esse centro. Acrescentou que trabalham articuladamente com esse centro e com as entidades integrantes.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo disse que na própria proposta é dito que no Município tem de existir um Plano Municipal de Emergência de Proteção Civil destinado a enfrentar a generalidade das situações de emergência que se admitem no respetivo território. Considerou que é nesse sentido que algumas perguntas foram feitas e espera uma resposta, porque este plano, pelo que se diz no considerando, deve enfrentar as situações de emergência possíveis da Cidade, incluindo estas situações dos sem-abrigo e das cheias.
Disse que o que vai ser votado é uma nova discussão pública, mas terá maior atenção às opiniões que possam surgir nestas diferentes áreas, tendo em conta aquilo que foi dito, ou seja, que é a aplicação da diretiva da Comissão Nacional de Proteção Civil. Considerou que deve ter essa orientação e, como não a leu, não sabe se tem.
Aprovada, por unanimidade.
segments.text_en:
14. Submission to public consultation of the 2nd Revision of the Municipal Emergency Plan for Civil Protection of Porto.
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola underlined the relevance of this Municipal Emergency Plan for Civil Protection, as there have been several issues in the City of Porto that report to Civil Protection and to the Municipal Emergency Plan. He added that there are questions that arise about the Plan itself that he would like to see clarified before the public consultation, which are related to the idea of the seasonal response in health and the need for a contingency plan for homeless people that is not addressed in this Municipal Plan at all. He addressed the issue of temporary shelter places which, in the seasonal health response, indicates that they have to be in the Municipal Civil Protection Emergency Plan and are not either, with only the areas of concentration and reception of the population that decrease from 13 to 4. He asked the reason for this decrease.
He also asked where the special plans for the Historic Center and floods are; and where is the flood area risk map that existed in the previous version, which he considers to be extremely important that it is maintained and that there is a plan regarding this issue.
He suggested the existence of a permanent subcommittee in the event of floods and floods as the Law allows.
He asked about the municipal meteorological network, which he believes may have an impact on the activation of some mechanisms, namely on the issue of thermal change, which is more sensitive and can better define in the City what are the degrees that are occurring. He asked if it is in operation, if all the points are, how many points there are and if it is being channeled to make this identification to respond to the most vulnerable population.
Councillor Catarina Araújo requested authorisation from the President so that the Director *******************************************, *************, and the Chief ************************************************************, **************, can give some clarification on more technical and operational issues that were raised by Councillor Maria Manuel Rola.
He said that there is some confusion, because the contingency plans for the cold weather that Councilwoman Maria Manuel Rola refers to are not an integral part of this plan nor should they be. He added that these are autonomous issues that are being dealt with autonomously.
Chief ************************************************************, ************** said that the Municipal Civil Protection Emergency Plan works on natural, technological and mixed risks and addresses the issue of cold wave and heat wave, which is much more demanding than a cold weather reaction that they are now defining as part of a contingency plan. He clarified that the contingency plan is not worked on in the form of a Municipal Civil Protection Emergency Plan.
On risk mapping and the issue of flooding, he said that they are working on a revision of the Municipal Civil Protection Emergency Plan, which will be the second revision that complies with a directive, a resolution of the National Civil Protection Commission, so they will have a third and last generation Municipal Civil Protection Emergency Plan. He added that risk cartography was removed from the elaboration of this new generation of municipal emergency plans, because most of the time they can talk about the susceptibility of the occurrence of risk and there is no necessary period, a history of antecedents necessary to effectively reach what the risk is.
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola asked why the temporary shelter places are not defined in the letter and why there is a reduction in the concentration and reception areas of the population from 13 to 4.
He said that contingency plans and special plans are autonomous, but they are not even named in the Municipal Civil Protection Emergency Plan itself and, in his opinion, there should be this articulation.
The Chief*************************************************************, ************** said, regarding the areas of concentration and reception of the population, that they defined 3 and distributed these spaces by areas of the City that seem to be sufficient to respond. He added that they have the survey of schools and other entities that meet the requirements to form a zone of concentration and reception of the population.
Regarding the shelter sites, he considered that they are related to the issue of the contingency plan for cold weather and this is being worked on in a contingency plan that they are preparing.
Regarding the issue of floods, he said that in the City of Porto there is a flood prediction and prevention center that is located at the headquarters of the captaincy of Porto Douro, whose captain of Porto Douro is responsible for convening all the competent entities that make up this center. He added that they work in conjunction with this center and with the member entities.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo said that in the proposal itself it is said that in the Municipality there must be a Municipal Emergency Plan for Civil Protection aimed at facing most of the emergency situations that are admitted in the respective territory. He considered that it is in this sense that some questions were asked and he expects an answer, because this plan, according to what is said in the recital, must face the possible emergency situations of the City, including these situations of homelessness and floods.
He said that what will be voted on is a new public discussion, but he will pay greater attention to the opinions that may arise in these different areas, taking into account what has been said, that is, that it is the application of the directive of the National Civil Protection Commission. He considered that he must have this guidance and, as he has not read it, he does not know if he does.
Approved, unanimously.

15. Alteração do Código Regulamentar do Município do Porto -- Parte D Título I - Ocupação do Espaço Público com Animador de Rua -- Nova submissão a consulta pública.
A Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola disse que na primeira discussão que fizeram sobre esta matéria pareceu que estava tudo muito pouco maturado pelo Executivo e deram o benefício da dúvida votando favoravelmente à consulta, para que se fizesse uma boa consulta e para que outras áreas do Executivo fossem envolvidas neste processo, desde logo a Cultura.
Referiu que a consulta em si foi ótima, mas o resultado que têm é, do seu ponto de vista, péssimo.
Sublinhou que desconsideram a consulta pública e diz-se que existiram apenas 16 participações consideradas, mas que existe todo um outro conjunto de participações, que devem estar no relatório.
Afirmou que há situações às quais são dadas resposta no relatório que lhes é dito que não estão no âmbito do Regulamento e ainda assim foram consideradas. Acrescentou que foi, diversas vezes, sugerido, até por estruturas representativas dos artistas, a medição e limitação de decibéis e recorrer a mapas de ruído da Cidade, questão que não foi considerada preguiçosamente e apenas se proíbe tout court a amplificação.
Perguntou se vão começar a proibir obras em prédios, buzinas e outros problemas de tudo intenso e incomodativo na Cidade. Considerou que está a ser demagógica, mas parece-lhe que este ridículo demonstra também o ridículo que está aqui.
Disse que não são aceites a maior parte das propostas que modelam licenças conforme as atividades, ruído e horários.
Referiu que são desconsideradas atividades e insistem na definição de animador, sendo que existe uma definição que está no Regulamento para o animador de rua, que diz que é aquele que desempenha qualquer tipo de manifestação cultural ou artística no espaço público. Considerou que isto deve ser avaliado, tendo em conta que estas pessoas são artistas.
Afirmou que a Vereação da Cultura terá algo a dizer num Regulamento que lhe parece que, ao contrário do que foi dito inicialmente na primeira reunião, quer proibir ou, pelo menos, perseguir a atividade.
Disse que em nenhum espaço se refere que o objetivo é valorizar a atividade e os artistas, nem se reconhece direitos além dos deveres. Considerou que a proibição da atividade também está inscrita, desde logo, através de taxas abusivas, que pode levar ao limite de 365 euros, por ano, de ocupação do espaço público, que é o valor máximo possível e é o único que estes artistas podem recorrer. Mencionou que, em Lisboa, taxas deste valor, em 2015, empurraram os artistas de rua para a ilegalidade e fuga à polícia. Perguntou se é isso que se pretende com este Regulamento.
Quanto à licença especial de ruído que é desenhada para festivais e não para artistas de rua, disse que não fazem ruído em situações especiais, trabalham música diariamente. Referiu que estas licenças podem chegar a 42 horas por hora, ao fim de semana. Acrescentou que existe uma proposta mais sensata sobre a proibição de amplificação, que já referiu, que diz que os animadores de rua deveriam poder usar amplificação, com um máximo de 60 watts e, no caso de atuações com mais de 1 elemento, apenas deveria ser permitida a utilização do amplificador por licença.
Considerou que a proibição de manifestações circenses em canais viários é chocante. Referiu que a proibição de locais de atuação aumenta e continuam a não ser credíveis as razões dessa proibição.
Sobre a discricionariedade, disse que inclui no Regulamento, a magia, a mímica, marionetas e estátuas ao vivo ou artes circenses e retiram as tunas académicas que também têm intervenção artística no espaço público.
Afirmou que este Regulamento vai ser um martírio para os artistas, para a Câmara e não vai resolver os conflitos que se colocam nos dias de hoje e que os artistas têm levantado.
Lamentou, porque pensaram que seria inicialmente ignorância sobre a atividade dos artistas de rua nas ruas da Cidade, mas agora percebe que é uma perseguição deliberada, algo com a qual não compactuam.
O Senhor Presidente disse, sobre o comentário feito pelo BE de perseguição a artistas de rua, que a Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola não conhece a realidade da Cidade.
Referiu que existem artistas de rua e são esses que querem proteger, depois há animadores de rua que causam enorme transtorno às pessoas e aos lojistas, sendo isso que se pretende regular.
Considerou que 60 watts é bastante. Considerou também que é curioso que o BE ande preocupado com a gentrificação. Afirmou que a pior forma de gentrificação numa Cidade é permitirem que algumas pessoas cheguem como turistas e, de repente, se coloquem à porta de alguém a infernizar a vida das pessoas.
Disse que é evidente que têm uma preocupação com os verdadeiros artistas de rua, que querem preservar através desta medida.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo disse que é sabido que participou numa sessão que foi feita, que foi importante para se perceber melhor todo este processo dos artistas ou animadores de rua. Afirmou que foi interessante e, na altura, teve a oportunidade de dizer que foi uma iniciativa positiva.
Referiu que esperou que as propostas de alteração tivessem mais atenção a várias situações que foram referidas e que acredita que têm toda a razão de ser, embora este seja um setor complicado, porque isto joga com diferentes interesses na Cidade, entre os quais, e como foi mencionado pelo Senhor Presidente, o dos moradores e o dos comerciantes. Considerou que conciliar tudo isto não é tarefa fácil.
Na sua opinião, os custos e taxas são excessivos.
Considerou que se pode ir mais longe na proposta que é apresentada e que ela pode ser uma outra tentativa de conciliação que não é apenas do turismo ou da cultura, que é também do comércio e da habitação. Acrescentou que estas quatro componentes e provavelmente estes quatro Vereadores e técnicos deveriam estar envolvidos neste processo para ter em conta essa conciliação.
O Senhor Presidente afirmou que os vereadores mencionados estão envolvidos no processo.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo admitiu que assim seja. Disse que foi a uma reunião que a Senhora Vereadora promoveu com os artistas, sobre a qual recebeu a informação.
O Senhor Presidente disse que a Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo sabe que têm problemas com, por exemplo, as colunas que são colocadas na Cordoaria. Referiu que se não houver um Regulamento todas essas pessoas vão dizer que são artistas.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo disse que está a falar da conciliação de todos estes aspetos que o Regulamento tem de ter em conta e considerou que é preciso fazer um esforço maior para os conseguirem conciliar.
O Senhor Presidente disse que este tema ainda vai estar em discussão pública, a Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo pode participar.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo declarou que se irá abster nesta votação, porque considera que é possível ir mais longe nesta tentativa de conciliação dos diferentes interesses, que também devem passar pela defesa dos artistas.
O Senhor Vereador Alberto Machado disse que a hora já vai adiantada e solicitou que tentassem cumprir os tempos, que aliás já estão esgotados.
Aprovada por maioria, com 3 abstenções dos Senhores Vereadores do PS e da Senhora Vereadora da CDU e com 1 voto contra da Senhora Vereadora do BE.
A Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola disse que entregará uma declaração de voto. (Anexo VII)

15. Amendment of the Regulatory Code of the Municipality of Porto - Part D Title I - Occupation of Public Space with Street Entertainer - New submission to public consultation.
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola said that in the first discussion they had on this matter it seemed that everything was very little matured by the Executive and they gave the benefit of the doubt by voting in favour of the consultation, so that a good consultation could be made and so that other areas of the Executive were involved in this process, starting with Culture.
He said that the consultation itself was great, but the result they have is, from his point of view, terrible.
He stressed that they disregard the public consultation and it is said that there were only 16 participations considered, but that there is a whole other set of participations, which should be in the report.
He said that there are situations that are addressed in the report that are said to be addressed that are not within the scope of the Regulation and yet they have been considered. He added that it was suggested, several times, even by structures representing the artists, the measurement and limitation of decibels and the use of noise maps of the City, an issue that was not considered lazily and only amplification is prohibited tout court.
He asked if they will start prohibiting works on buildings, horns and other problems of everything intense and bothersome in the City. He considered that he is being demagogic, but it seems to him that this ridicule also demonstrates the ridicule that is here.
He said that most of the proposals that model licenses according to activities, noise and schedules are not accepted.
He said that activities are disregarded and insist on the definition of animator, and there is a definition that is in the Regulation for the street entertainer, which says that he is the one who performs any type of cultural or artistic manifestation in the public space. He considered that this should be evaluated, taking into account that these people are artists.
He said that the Councillor for Culture will have something to say in a Regulation that seems to him that, contrary to what was initially said at the first meeting, it wants to prohibit or, at least, persecute the activity.
He said that in no space is it mentioned that the objective is to value the activity and the artists, nor is it recognized rights beyond duties. He considered that the prohibition of the activity is also inscribed, from the outset, through abusive fees, which can lead to a limit of 365 euros, per year, for the occupation of public space, which is the maximum possible amount and is the only one that these artists can appeal. He mentioned that, in Lisbon, fees of this value, in 2015, pushed street artists into illegality and evade the police. He asked whether that is what this regulation is about.
As for the special noise license that is designed for festivals and not for street artists, he said that they do not make noise in special situations, they work on music daily. He said that these leaves can reach 42 hours per hour at the weekend. He added that there is a more sensible proposal on the prohibition of amplification, which he has already mentioned, which says that street entertainers should be able to use amplification, with a maximum of 60 watts and, in the case of performances with more than 1 element, only the use of the amplifier per license should be allowed.
He considered that the prohibition of circus demonstrations on road channels is shocking. He said that the prohibition of places of performance increases and the reasons for this prohibition are still not credible.
Regarding discretion, he said that he includes in the Regulation, magic, mime, puppets and live statues or circus arts and remove the academic tunas that also have artistic intervention in the public space.
He said that this Regulation will be a martyrdom for the artists, for the Chamber and will not resolve the conflicts that arise today and that the artists have raised.
He regretted it, because they thought it would initially be ignorance about the activity of street artists on the streets of the city, but now he realizes that it is a deliberate persecution, something with which they do not condone.
The President said, about the comment made by the BE about the persecution of street artists, that Councillor Maria Manuel Rola does not know the reality of the City.
He said that there are street artists and they are the ones they want to protect, then there are street entertainers who cause enormous inconvenience to people and shopkeepers, which is what is intended to be regulated.
He considered that 60 watts is enough. He also considered that it is curious that the BE is concerned about gentrification. He said that the worst form of gentrification in a city is to allow some people to arrive as tourists and suddenly put themselves at someone's door to make people's lives hell.
He said that it is evident that they have a concern for the real street artists, which they want to preserve through this measure.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo said that it is known that she participated in a session that was held, which was important to better understand this whole process of street artists or entertainers. He said that it was interesting and, at the time, he had the opportunity to say that it was a positive initiative.
He said that he hoped that the proposed amendments would pay more attention to various situations that have been mentioned and that he believes that they have every reason to exist, although this is a complicated sector, because this plays with different interests in the City, among which, and as mentioned by the President, that of the residents and that of the merchants. He considered that reconciling all this is not an easy task.
In his opinion, the costs and fees are excessive.
He considered that we can go further in the proposal that is presented and that it can be another attempt at conciliation that is not only about tourism or culture, which is also about commerce and housing. He added that these four components and probably these four Councilors and technicians should be involved in this process to take into account this conciliation.
The President said that the councilors mentioned are involved in the process.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo admitted that this is the case. He said that he went to a meeting that the Councilwoman promoted with the artists, about which she received the information.
The President said that Councillor Ilda Figueiredo knows that they have problems with, for example, the columns that are placed in Cordoaria. He said that if there is no Regulation all these people will say that they are artists.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo said that she is talking about the reconciliation of all these aspects that the Regulation has to take into account and considered that it is necessary to make a greater effort to be able to reconcile them.
The President said that this issue will still be under public discussion, Councillor Ilda Figueiredo can participate.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo declared that she will abstain from this vote, because she considers that it is possible to go further in this attempt to reconcile the different interests, which should also include the defence of artists.
Councilor Alberto Machado said that the time is already late and asked them to try to meet the times, which by the way are already exhausted.
Approved by majority, with 3 abstentions from the Councillors of the PS and the Councillor of the CDU and with 1 vote against from the Councillor of BE.
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola said that she will deliver an explanation of vote. (Annex VII)

16. Alteração ao Regulamento de Isenções de Impostos Municipais do Município do Porto e à Parte G do Código Regulamentar do Município do Porto.
A Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola disse que na proposta é referido que existiram vários interessados que se constituíram durante a constituição da fase de interessados e que participaram bastante na elaboração do Regulamento. Perguntou do que é que se está a falar, de quantas participações, que tipo de propostas e que sugestões foram feitas. Perguntou se existe um relatório no caso da constituição de interessados.
O Senhor Vereador Pedro Baganha disse que não tem essa informação.
O Senhor Vereador Ricardo Valente disse que existe esse relatório.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo disse que vota a favor, porque esta alteração ao Regulamento de Isenções de Impostos Municipais do Município do Porto contempla algumas das propostas que tem vindo a defender, que já estiveram num Regulamento anterior como, por exemplo, a isenção para as associações de moradores, que são proprietárias; a diminuição do IMI para os proprietários de habitação e que residem na mesma.
Aprovada, por maioria, com 1 abstenção da Senhora Vereadora do BE.
segments.text_en:
16. Amendment to the Regulation of Municipal Tax Exemptions of the Municipality of Porto and to Part G of the Regulatory Code of the Municipality of Porto.
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola said that in the proposal it is mentioned that there were several interested parties who were constituted during the constitution of the interested party phase and who participated a lot in the preparation of the Regulation. He asked what is being talked about, how many participations, what kind of proposals and what suggestions were made. He asked if there is a report in the case of the constitution of interested parties.
Councilman Pedro Baganha said he does not have this information.
Councilman Ricardo Valente said that there is such a report.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo said that she votes in favour, because this amendment to the Regulation of Municipal Tax Exemptions of the Municipality of Porto contemplates some of the proposals that she has been defending, which have already been in a previous Regulation, such as, for example, the exemption for residents' associations, which are owners; the reduction of IMI for housing owners who live in it.
Approved, by majority, with 1 abstention from the Councillor of BE.

A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo disse que vota contra por considerar que as pessoas com mais baixos rendimentos, que são quem mais precisam de apoios municipais, precisam de mais receita para que a Câmara as apoie. Considerou que não são essas pessoas que são beneficiadas, pelo contrário, são as prejudicadas na medida em que a Câmara vai passar a ter um menor rendimento.
O Senhor Vereador Alberto Machado deu nota de que o PSD votará a favor deste ponto, mencionando que tem feito parte do seu acordo de governação da Cidade. Disse que entendem que é justo elogiar o esforço do Executivo em procurar equilibrar as receitas com as despesas que o Município tem, permitindo-se libertar o peso da carga fiscal que incide sobre os portuenses.
Aprovada, por maioria, com 2 votos contra da Senhoras Vereadora da CDU e do BE.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo disse que entregará uma declaração de voto. (Anexo VIII)
A Senhora Vereadora Maria Manuel Rola disse que entregará uma declaração de voto para a proposta 18, 19 e 20. (Anexo IX)
segments.text_en:
18. Establishment of the variable participation in the IRS of taxpayers with tax domicile in the municipality of Porto.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo said that she votes against because she considers that people with lower incomes, who are the ones who most need municipal support, need more revenue for the City Council to support them. He considered that it is not these people who are benefited, on the contrary, they are the ones harmed to the extent that the Chamber will have a lower income.
Councillor Alberto Machado noted that the PSD will vote in favour of this point, mentioning that it has been part of his City governance agreement. He said that they understand that it is fair to praise the Executive's effort in seeking to balance revenues with the expenses that the Municipality has, allowing itself to release the burden of the tax burden that falls on the people of Porto.
Approved, by majority, with 2 votes against from the Councillor of CDU and BE.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo said she will deliver an explanation of vote. (Annex VIII)
Councillor Maria Manuel Rola said that she will deliver an explanation of vote for proposal 18, 19 and 20. (Annex IX)

21. Fixação da Taxa Municipal de Direitos de Passagem para o ano 2024.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo perguntou se as empresas públicas que fazem os Direitos de Passagem ficam com o dinheiro.
O Senhor Presidente disse que terá, através do Parlamento, convocar o regulador.
O Senhor Vereador Ricardo Valente disse que é um ponto importante, sendo que a Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo já tinha colocado essa questão. Referiu que a Câmara do Porto recebeu, destes Direitos de Passagem, um valor de cerca de 101 mil euros em 2022.
Deu nota de que face ao esforço que o Município do Porto tem vindo a fazer ao longo dos anos, junto da ANACOM, esta colocou em discussão pública um regulamento que obriga as empresas de telecomunicações a discriminarem estes Direitos de Passagem. Afirmou que finalmente o regulador ouviu o que a Câmara do Porto tem vindo a dizer ao longo dos anos.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo disse que talvez quando isso acontecer vote a favor. Afirmou que enquanto ficarem o dinheiro votará contra.
Aprovada, por maioria, com 1 voto contra da Senhora Vereadora da CDU.
segments.text_en:
21. Setting of the Municipal Fee for Rights of Way for the year 2024.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo asked if the public companies that make the Rights of Way keep the money.
You said that you will have to summon the regulator through Parliament.
Councillor Ricardo Valente said that it is an important point, and Councillor Ilda Figueiredo had already raised this issue. He said that the Porto City Council received, from these Rights of Passage, a value of around 101 thousand euros in 2022.
He noted that in view of the effort that the Municipality of Porto has been making over the years, with ANACOM, the latter has put up for public discussion a regulation that obliges telecommunications companies to discriminate against these Rights of Passage. He said that finally the regulator listened to what the Porto City Council has been saying over the years.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo said that maybe when that happens she will vote in favour. He said that as long as they stay, the money will vote against it.
Approved, by majority, with 1 vote against from the CDU Councilor.

1. Atribuição de Medalhas Municipais.
O Senhor Presidente explicou que esta proposta resulta de uma articulação entre as forças políticas representadas na AM numa decisão unânime que foi negociada entre todas as forças políticas. Agradeceu ao Senhor Presidente da AM a forma como tudo decorreu. Sublinhou que é ao Executivo Municipal que cabe votar esta proposta.
Deu nota de que existe uma pequena alteração na ficha do Senhor Dr. ************, ou seja, é referido que o Senhor Dr. ************ foi adjunto de Vereador e pediu que fosse inserido o nome do Vereador em questão, neste caso o Senhor Dr. ***************.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo disse que esta proposta resulta de várias contribuições, mas pediu, mais uma vez, que na próxima proposta haja uma participação maior de mulheres.
O Senhor Presidente disse que acredita que, daqui a 30 ou 40 anos, a situação será inversa.
Sublinhou que as propostas da CDU foram todas aceites.
Aprovada, por unanimidade.
O Senhor Presidente disse que cabe aos Serviços notificar as pessoas em causa.
Afirmou que a cerimónia está prevista para o dia 9 de julho, às 11 horas, no Roseiral. Explicou que escolheram a data de 9 de julho pois foi nesse dia que o exército libertador entrou no Porto e entrou pela Rua 9 de Julho.
Entrou na Sala o Senhor Vereador Ricardo Valente.
segments.text_en:
1. Attribution of Municipal Medals.
The President explained that this proposal is the result of an articulation between the political forces represented in the AM in a unanimous decision that was negotiated between all political forces. He thanked the President of AM for the way everything went. He stressed that it is up to the Municipal Executive to vote on this proposal.
He noted that there is a small change in Dr. ************'s file, that is, it is mentioned that Dr. ************ was deputy to the Councilor and asked that the name of the Councilor in question be inserted, in this case Dr. ***************.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo said that this proposal is the result of several contributions, but asked, once again, that in the next proposal there be a greater participation of women.
You have said that you believe that in 30 or 40 years' time the situation will be reversed.
He stressed that the CDU's proposals were all accepted.
Approved, unanimously.
You said that it is up to the services to notify the people concerned.
He said that the ceremony is scheduled for July 9, at 11 am, in Roseiral. He explained that they chose the date of July 9 because it was on that day that the liberating army entered Porto and entered through Rua 9 de Julho.
Councilman Ricardo Valente entered the Room.

2. Aprovação de Acordo de Colaboração com a Associação dos Comerciantes do Porto.
A Senhora Vereadora Ilda Figueiredo perguntou se existe um balanço de uma das últimas ações de apoio ao comércio relacionada com cupões.
Declarou que votará a favor.
O Senhor Vereador Ricardo Valente disse que já existe um balanço, que foi publicado no "Porto.". Deu nota de que foram publicados os valores quer do ponto de vista do número de comerciantes quer do ponto de vista dos valores em causa. Disponibilizou-se a apresentar o relatório detalhado, onde estão identificados todos os comerciantes e as zonas da Cidade onde os descontos foram realizados. Referiu, por curiosidade, que o estabelecimento que mais descontos conseguiu fazer foi um pequeno estabelecimento comercial na Freguesia de Campanhã. Sublinhou que este programa depende da participação dos comerciantes e das decisões dos detentores do "Cartão Porto.". Disse que distribuirá o referido relatório aos Senhores Vereadores.
O Senhor Vereador Sérgio Aires disse que este protocolo de cooperação com a Associação dos Comerciantes poderia ir mais longe. Considerou que faria sentido um mapeamento daqueles estabelecimentos comerciais que ainda estão em funcionamento e que têm uma dimensão histórica para a Cidade e, sobretudo, daqueles que estão em risco e que, portanto, convém preservar.
Referiu que se existe o protocolo para favorecer, preservar, aumentar e capacitar o comércio e os comerciantes da Cidade seria importante avançar, nomeadamente promovendo os circuitos curtos, conhecer bem a localização dos estabelecimentos no sentido de os apoiar e de os ajudar a criar a capacidade de resistir à forte pressão imobiliária.
Aprovada, por unanimidade.
segments.text_en:
2. Approval of the Collaboration Agreement with the Association of Merchants of Porto.
Councillor Ilda Figueiredo asked if there is a balance of one of the latest actions to support commerce related to coupons.
He declared that he will vote in favor.
Councillor Ricardo Valente said that there is already a balance sheet, which was published in "Porto". He noted that the values were published both from the point of view of the number of traders and from the point of view of the values in question. He made himself available to present the detailed report, where all the merchants and the areas of the city where the discounts were made are identified. He said, out of curiosity, that the establishment that managed to make the most discounts was a small commercial establishment in the Parish of Campanhã. He stressed that this program depends on the participation of merchants and the decisions of the holders of the "Porto Card." He said that he will distribute the aforementioned report to the Councilors.
Councillor Sérgio Aires said that this cooperation protocol with the Association of Traders could go further. He considered that it would make sense to map those commercial establishments that are still in operation and that have a historical dimension for the City and, above all, those that are at risk and that, therefore, should be preserved.
He said that if there is a protocol to favor, preserve, increase and empower commerce and merchants in the City, it would be important to move forward, namely by promoting short circuits, knowing well the location of establishments in order to support them and help them create the ability to resist strong real estate pressure.
Approved, unanimously.

3. Aprovação da criação da "Linha de Apoio à Aquisição de Veículos Elétricos".
O Senhor Vereador Sérgio Aires disse que na proposta não são referidos os critérios de candidatura nem de seleção das entidades.
O Senhor Vereador Fernando Paulo explicou que a Segurança Social, no âmbito do PRR, abriu uma linha de financiamento para viaturas elétricas para apoio domiciliário, à qual concorreram 32 entidades, entretanto, 2 entidades desistiram. Referiu que o apoio que é concedido é, até ao máximo, de 25 mil euros; o investimento rondará os 35/40 mil euros por parte das entidades e foram sensibilizados para o facto de que algumas entidades teriam dificuldade em assumir sozinhas a contrapartida nacional. Explicou que entenderam, em vez de fazer o subsídio direto, abrir uma linha de financiamento, sendo que a colocam a concurso. Referiu que esta linha é específica, ou seja, só são elegíveis as entidades que comprovem que possuem o termo de aceitação.
Afirmou que, se a Câmara não se associasse, algumas das entidades não tinham verba e desistiriam apesar de terem assinado o termo.
O Senhor Vereador Sérgio Aires perguntou se a Câmara tem um limite, ou seja, não vai financiar todas as entidades.
O Senhor Vereador Fernando Paulo respondeu que a Câmara vai financiar todas as entidades.
O Senhor Vereador Sérgio Aires pediu que fosse feita uma apresentação sobre todos os desafios em que a CMP se envolveu no âmbito do PRR.
O Senhor Presidente disse que, em rigor, esta situação não é PRR, é fundos da CMP. Explicou que, havendo uma insuficiência do PRR, estão a contribuir com a comparticipação nacional.
O Senhor Vereador Fernando Paulo disse que vão reunir para priorizar as candidaturas e numa próxima reunião irão apresentá-las.
O Senhor Vereador Sérgio Aires pediu que fosse feita uma apresentação daqueles que são os projetos e os investimentos.
Aprovada, por unanimidade.
segments.text_en:
3. Approval of the creation of the "Support Line for the Acquisition of Electric Vehicles".
Councilor Sérgio Aires said that the proposal does not mention the criteria for candidacy or selection of entities.
Councilor Fernando Paulo explained that Social Security, within the scope of the PRR, opened a line of financing for electric vehicles for home support, to which 32 entities applied, however, 2 entities gave up. He said that the support that is granted is, up to a maximum, 25 thousand euros; The investment will be around 35/40 thousand euros by the entities and they were made aware of the fact that some entities would have difficulty in assuming the national counterpart alone. He explained that they understood, instead of making the direct subsidy, to open a line of financing, and they put it out to tender. He said that this line is specific, that is, only entities that prove that they have the term of acceptance are eligible.
He said that, if the Chamber did not join, some of the entities did not have funds and would give up despite having signed the term.
Councilor Sérgio Aires asked if the Chamber has a limit, that is, it will not finance all entities.
Councilman Fernando Paulo replied that the Chamber will finance all entities.
Councillor Sérgio Aires asked for a presentation to be made on all the challenges in which the CMP has been involved within the scope of the PRR.
You said that, strictly speaking, this situation is not PRR, it is CMP funds. He explained that, if there is an insufficiency of the RRP, they are contributing to the national contribution.
Councilor Fernando Paulo said that they will meet to prioritize the candidacies and in a next meeting they will present them.
Councilor Sérgio Aires asked for a presentation of what the projects and investments are.
Approved, unanimously.
